description: Dive into "Ravello's Coastal Escapes: Sun, Sand, Serenity" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Ravello's Coastal Escapes: Sun, Sand, Serenity

places.generalDescription: Lido di Ravello Beach Club is a charming pebble beach club located in Castiglione di Ravello, along the road to Amalfi. It offers sun loungers and umbrellas for rent, as well as a seafood restaurant and cocktail bar. The beach provides a lovely setting for swimming and soaking up the sun. However, parking can be challenging, and there may be some pollution from nearby construction work.

sources.snippet: Ravello is one of the most charming towns on the Amalfi Coast, and its lovely beach is one of the most popular travel destinations known for its intimacy, majestic sun-kissed shoreline and gorgeous villas. Rocks and cliffs surround it, though, so it does get shady towards the afternoon, but its location also provides beachgoers with more privacy. Despite its popularity, this beach doesn‚Äôt get as crowded as some of the others.
sources.shortName: Amalfi Coast Beaches : All You Need to Know

sources.snippet: Castiglione di Ravello is a beach located in the town of Ravello, one of the most charming towns on the Amalfi Coast. I definitely recommend you to visit this beach if you are looking for a quiet atmosphere and beautiful villas around it. Keep in mind that this place is surrounded by rocks and large cliffs.

A beautiful hike on the Amalfi Coast starting from the village of Ravello. This round trip takes place mainly on stairs, for a total of about 1400 steps, towards the Castiglione Beach, passing by the Church of Santi Filippo e Giacomo. Along the entire route, the views on the coast are beautiful.

places.name: Lido di Ravello Beach Club

reviews.text:
Pure class....worth ‚Ç¨75 for two beds & umbrella.....with showers, changing rooms, water & inflatable to lie in the sea......the beach is pebbles, so bring footware. Crystal clear water & spotless beach.
The beach club has happy staff, and gorgeous food (see my pictures)
Joshua - young waiter was really helpful & all the staff were amazing..... including lifeguard. Beer & wine choice was great & quality.
From 12pm to 6pm we were there, kitchen closes 4pm.
Free public beach either side, bring your towel / inflatable to lie on though.
Spectacular day, stunning views, even the steps down/up are stunning.......100 steps, so take your time.

Really nice place. Do not trust the reviews claiming the stairs are daunting and long, they are just lazy and not used to climbing 50 stairs at once without AC. Stairs take about two minutes and take you to the beach, which has a shower, public and private area. The staff were accommodating and food options were tasty and varied. Mostly locals.

The beach is more secluded, nestled among the rocks, descending toward Amalfi.
Sunbeds cost ‚Ç¨70, including an umbrella.
The sun goes behind the cliffs around 4:00 PM in the free areas; near the rocks, it might last a little longer.
By 4:00 PM, people are already leaving and the umbrellas start being taken down.
The water is beautiful-you'll need water shoes-but unfortunately, trash tends to accumulate in the area. Additionally, it's enclosed to allow a passageway for boats that dock or pass nearby.
Still, the location is much better than anything in Amalfi.
If you don't mind paying this amount for sun only until 4:00 PM, I would recommend it.

places.address: Strada Statale Amalfitana, 13, 84010 Castiglione SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Amalfi Coast is a UNESCO-listed landscape featuring small towns perched between mountains and the sea. A popular activity is the Classic Amalfi Coast walking tour, an 11-day journey along the Footpath of the Gods, offering unrivaled Italian coastal hiking. The self-guided walk allows exploration at a personalized pace through idyllic villages like Praiano, Positano, Sorrento, Amalfi, and Maestra dei Villaggi.

sources.snippet: If crystal-clear waters are what you're after, the Amalfi Coast won't disappoint. These beaches boast some of the clearest waters in the area:. Known as the "Fjord of the South," Furore Fjord is famous for its emerald-green waters and dramatic cliffs.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches on the Amalfi Coast

sources.snippet: Discover the best Amalfi Coast beaches for swimming, snorkeling, and relaxation. Enjoy hidden gems, family-friendly spots, and romantic escapes along this stunning coastline.
sources.siteName: Salerno and Amalfi Coast, Italy: travel guide and information

sources.shortName: Amalfi Coast Beaches : All You Need to Know

places.name: Amalfi Coast

reviews.text:
Breathtaking and unforgettable!

The Amalfi Coast is truly one of the most stunning places you'll ever see-the views are absolutely postcard-perfect at every turn. Towering cliffs, sparkling turquoise waters, and picturesque villages make this destination something straight out of a dream.

I highly recommend visiting by coach if possible. The roads are incredibly narrow, winding, and steep, and while experienced drivers might manage, it's not for the faint-hearted! If you do decide to drive, go for a small car-a big vehicle would be a real challenge on those roads.

Beaches are beautiful but often require a walk down the cliffs, and some do charge for entry. It's worth it for the experience, though! The restaurants along the coast are wonderful-laid-back, welcoming, and happy to let you enjoy your meal without rushing you, which is refreshing in such a popular tourist spot.

Parking is expensive-around ‚Ç¨10 per hour-so if you're driving, plan to make the most of your time there.

Honestly, words don't do it justice-I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. A place you'll never forget!

Most beautiful place
One day trip it's enough but easily you can stay more
There is a lot of hotels
And beautiful places to see
And beaches
The road is beautiful
We took car that can open the roof
So the view was amazing.

The road is with a lot of curves so need to drive slowly
I recommend to take a small car it will be easier to maneuver.
there is difficult to find parking except the parking lots

Just drive along the road the pictures
Stop where you can
And enjoy

In the summer there is a lots of cars so prepare yourself üôèüòÄ

So far my favorite area / day excursion this trip. The small towns tucked into the hill sides all the way down to the pristine beaches. Exquisite. Don't let the "life style of the rich and famous" reputation run you off because the small towns are amazing and the locals even better.

places.generalDescription: Il Duoglio Spiaggia is a stunning beach located between Vietri sul Mare and Amalfi. It offers a larger version of Gavitella with beautiful sun exposure until early afternoon. Accessible by boat, the coast has private areas where you can rent sun beds and umbrellas or enjoy the public space with your own umbrella. The Lido degli Artisti restaurant provides friendly service and delicious beach food and drinks.

sources.snippet: We just talked about a beach for families with children, but what about sport lovers?. If you can‚Äôt stop moving even when you are on vacation and you want to mix business with pleasure, Duoglio beach is the right place for you!. It is a pebbly beach and it is a mile away from Amalfi.
sources.shortName: The five most beautiful beaches on the Amalfi Coast - Blog

sources.snippet: It is less than a ten minute bus ride from the center of Amalfi. It is a beautiful place with an admirable natural view where the mountains take all the limelight. If you want to make one of the best excursions from Amalfi, you can include this beach in your itinerary.

places.name: Il Duoglio Spiaggia

reviews.text: We loved this beach so much that we went four times while in Amalfi. There are some negative reviews and limited information about this beach, which may deter some, but will try to clear up somethings. The beach is accessible by stairs or by boat from Amalfi. There are two businesses there that offer a restaurant/bar and beds/umbrellas. I Due Scugnizzi has pairs of beds ranging from approximately ‚Ç¨30-60, and the staff were very friendly-we got along with them well best price for cleanest prettiest beach. Lido Degli Artisti has more expensive beds. They also have a ‚Äòsit-down restaurant' section, but they require you to spend a minimum (more than the cost of a meal for two with drink for each). Overall, we had a great experience with the food and drinks at I Due Scugnizzi. On our last day, we got caught in a storm for an hour, and I Due Scugnizzi kindly invited the people at the free beach to take cover.

This beach was a true hidden gem during our trip along the Amalfi Coast. Il Duoglio Spiaggia is a small, peaceful beach tucked away from the crowds and noise, accessible either by a scenic staircase or by boat.

The water here is crystal clear - some of the clearest I've seen in Italy. The beach is pebbly, so I recommend bringing water shoes, but that only adds to its charm.

I suggest arriving early in the morning to enjoy the quiet atmosphere and find a good spot.

Great little beach! The sunbeds cost from 25 to 70 per person, depending on how far from the sea you decide :) You can order cocktails (15eur mostly) or food to your spot. The beach is pebbled , so shoes are a must:D There is a also a free beach spot, where you can chill without paying. Lovely! There are about 500 stairs to reach the beach, not as bad as it sounds:D but you can also take a boat there, but I don't know the prices as we braved the stairs:D. Muuuch better beach than the main one , it was never full, so you can enjoy it in peace. Went there for two days :)

places.address: Via Mauro Comite, 25, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ristorante Santa Croce, originally a beach bar established in 1950, has evolved into a beloved restaurant serving traditional dishes to both vacationers and locals. Accessible only by sea from Amalfi, the restaurant offers a free transport service from Molo Darsena. The beach, named after an old chapel nearby, provides umbrellas, sun-loungers, and showers. Visitors praise the light and delicious food as well as the serene and private atmosphere of the beach.

sources.snippet: I know I said this was a guide to the beaches in Amalfi, but just take a look at that photo. Can you blame me for wanting to squeeze in one of my favorite beaches on the Amalfi Coast?. This is the Santa Croce beach, which while technically located in Amalfi is only reachable by a short boat ride.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Beaches of Amalfi

places.name: Santa Croce Restaurant e Beach Club Amalfi

reviews.text: Great little place tucked away on the Amalfi course. We had a large storm redirect our boat tour to this great little beach club and restaurant.  The staff was AMAZING and so kind and accommodating. Seafood is the name of the game and plenty of grilled seafood and gnocchi to fill our appetite.  Cocktails and Desert were fantastic.  Can't say enough about the service and staff.

Nice help with the buoy, and immediate transfer to the restaurant. We had to insist to get a table in the shade - the restaurant was busy and we did not have the chance to reserve upfront. The food was good, service friendly. Water is also nice for a swim. May be it is worthwile to make a booking upfront in high season. Overall we enjoyed our stop here during our daily boat trip/

Restaurant Santa Croce was AMAZING - including the staff, food, and location. We contacted the restaurant 48 hours before hosting a post-wedding event for 30 people in September 2024 and they jumped into action. (The location we originally booked never¬†confirmed and we had to scramble!) You would never know they organized last minute. The short boat ride from the main dock in Amalfi was coordinated for us and easy. The staff were welcoming ‚Äì including drinks as we got off the boats and snack baskets on the beach. After we swam and relaxed, the staff (with nonna!) prepared a delicious lunch with fresh ingredients including local specialities that included vegetables, fish, meat, pasta, dessert, and drinks. We returned to the beach after lunch and enjoyed the sun, water, and additional beverages before heading back to Amalfi. We highly recommend Restaurant Santa Croce!

places.address: Spiaggia, Via Santa Croce, 1, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: La Marinella is a charming beach located next to the La Marinella restaurant. It offers a small beach area with sunbeds and a deck, where you can enjoy snacks and drinks from the nearby bar. The water at this beach is known for its remarkable clarity and sparkle, making it very inviting for a swim. Families, especially those with young children, frequent this spot due to the ample shade below the deck and the calm swimming area.

sources.snippet: This little beach is tucked beside the restaurant La Marinella and they offer a small beach area and deck with sunbeds and snacks and drinks in the bar nearby. The water here tends to be remarkable clear and sparkly, which is oh so tempting when you walk by above. It‚Äôs another popular spot with families, especially with very young children, since there‚Äôs plenty of shade below the deck, the water is calm and the swimming area small.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Beaches of Amalfi

sources.snippet: La Marinella is a quiet beach located between the beaches Marina Grande and Lido delle Sirene. This is also a place you can walk to and reach in just five minutes.

places.name: La Marinella

reviews.text: Fortunately I didn't check the reviews before coming here, imo they dont do any justice for this restaurant. We ordered grilled steaks, mix fried seafoods, 2 pizza sets and quite happy with the quality as well as the generous portion. Most of the waiters are elderly so perhaps a bit colder compared to Italian standard? To conclude, dont let the bad comments deter you from coming to this restaurant.

It's alright - Lots of yours bring tourists here to eat. The food is edible but probably not the best meal you're ever going to have in your life. If you're looking to beat the heat and have a view, it's definitely a place to go. The food is expensive for what it is, but the service was friendly.
A great place to drink a fine coffee on the Cost of Amalfi. The prices are a little bit high, but it is near to the sea.

places.address: Via Lungomare dei Cavalieri, 1, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

sources.snippet: The most famous of the beaches of Amalfi is undoubtedly that of Marina Grande. As the name suggests, the beach has considerable dimensions, although it is possible to note its extension in length and not in width. The beach is composed of a very fine and soft fine sand, mixed with gravel and small pebbles.
sources.shortName: Amalfi Coast Beaches : All You Need to Know

places.name: Tonino's beach Amalfi Coast

reviews.text:
By far the best location in Amalfi for a couple or a family to rest in the sun, shade or sea. This 3 generation, family owned business is at the less crowded side of the beach and offers comfortable sunbeds, strong umbrellas, kayak excursions and choice of a hot or cold shower.
*Tonino Beach does NOT serve food or drinks, (you can easily find a bar/food nearby, or you can bring your own picnic)
*The beaches in Amalfi Coast are rocky so bring water shoes if you are new to this coastline.

It got two stars but I don't know why! The stones on this beach are the worst. Getting to the water from your sitting position was just impossible! üò©The water was clearer than Atrani beach round the corner but nothing like Capri. It was 9 euros for two small cokes but at least we had a few moments out of the sun.

Great place to enjoy a sunny day in Amalfi. We were able to reserve our chairs before arriving which was great. Staff was friendly and hard working. They keep the beach super clean.  Bring water shoes for the pebbles on the shore. There's a snack bar close by for both food and drink. There's a free fresh water shower on site and you can pay for a hot shower if you like after swimming.

places.address: Via Marina Grande V arcata, Viale della Regione, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Lido delle Sirene, also known as Mermaid Beach, is located at the other end of Amalfi, just a short 10-minute walk from Marina Grande beach. Unlike the crowded Marina Grande beach, Lido delle Sirene offers excellent beach services including showers, changing rooms, and a restaurant with a view of the beach. The pricing for amenities such as two chairs and an umbrella is considered reasonable compared to other popular beach destinations.

sources.snippet: If the Marina Grande beach might feel a little too crowded for your taste, then walk along the harbor to the other end of Amalfi where you‚Äôll find the Lido delle Sirene (Mermaid Beach) just beyond the confine of the port. It‚Äôs not a long walk, just about 10 minutes leisurely pace. Here you won‚Äôt find a spiaggia libera, but you will find an excellent beach service with shower, plenty of changing rooms and a restaurant overlooking the beach.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Beaches of Amalfi

sources.snippet: If you plan to be in Amalfi for only two days, you may prefer to go to a beach close to the city center. If this is your case, I recommend you to visit Lido selle Sirene. You can reach this beach on foot in less than 10 minutes.

places.name: Lido delle Sirene

reviews.text: Heaps of negative comments but we couldn't disagree more. ‚Ç¨55 for two sun beds, an umbrella and use of the changing rooms/toilets for the entire day (which is the standard in Amalfi). Options to set up your own towel on the beach for ‚Ç¨6 fee clearly written at the entrance in both Italian and English. Bar staff were friendly, fast wifi, beautiful cold drinks that are reasonably priced and a great quiet spot for a swim away from all the crowds in Amalfi. Couldn't recommend enough.

In terms of location, it is a quiet place to swim compared to the other beaches in the center of Amalfi.  The staff very kind, I have nothing to say about it.  But it is not possible for him to pay 55 euros just to take a bath in the sea, which I think is absolutely humane regardless of the place he is, whether it is touristic or not is also a matter of humanity, and from the moment that as a business you put a  such a price, at least he offered something to the customer, they didn't even offer us a glass of water.  I don't know if there were other options on the matter, but as a tourist I don't know them unless someone tells me.  Also, I don't mind paying a bit more, but it has some hidden value and isn't just expensive because it is.  The nice thing is that both the customer and the business owner have a good time, in this case only the business owner's pocket has a good time.  Personally, I wouldn't go to the area again, it's worth it just to take your walk, take your photos, drink a coffee, but that's about it.  And if I can prevent someone from losing money for no reason, I just will.  My opinion of course and it's nothing personal, I'm just saying what I saw.

I have no idea why there would be bad reviews for said location. Incredible little spot, lovely clean beach, bar, showers, changing rooms not over crowded. Sunbeds are 25 euros for 2 and you get a brolly. Water definitely doesn't smell. It's absolutely stunning, clear and packed with fish. Bring a snorkel!

places.address: Piazzale dei Protontini, 4, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Amalfi, a picturesque town on Italy's southwest coast, is nestled below steep cliffs and was once a powerful maritime republic. The Arab-Norman Sant'Andrea cathedral and the Museo Arsenale Amalfi offer glimpses into its medieval past. This popular tourist destination boasts natural and cultural landmarks, including UNESCO World Heritage Sites like the Amalfi Coast and the Archaeological Areas of Pompeii.

sources.snippet: Bustling Amalfi impresses with its seafront location and historical attractions. These include a museum in a centuries-old paper mill and a striking cathedral, a vestige of Amalfi‚Äôs past as a medieval maritime republic. Action is centered on Piazza del Duomo, an attractive square flanked by cafes, restaurants, and bars.
sources.shortName: WHERE TO STAY on the AMALFI COAST

sources.snippet: The Amalfi Coast is no secret, and some beaches tend to draw larger crowds than others. Here are the most popular beaches that you won't want to miss:. This iconic beach is often considered one of Italy's most beautiful.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches on the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Amalfi
